intro: Callista bicolor, commonly known as the twin-colored bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that display two distinct colors. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers in shades of blue and white. Callista bicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
